heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 14 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 6th since records began in 23 September 2024.  The current stretch started on 09 September 2025 and has lasted 8 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (195°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 589 m) and feels like temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 126.8m lower than yesterday, 20.3m higher than the past week, 588.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 943m to 2500m and averaged 1490.4m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, pleasant humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. The weather will likely remain the same.
